ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This is an advanced physical chemistry course. Be prepared to spend a considerable amount of time studying the material. However, you will learn a tremendous amount if you put the effort into the class.
If you are interested in Pchem field, you should take this class for sure.
I would say that the material covered in this class, while very interesting, is very difficult and at times seems very overwhelming.
I would summarize it as a very difficult survey of all the the basics of statistical mechanics. I would recommend it to another student with the caveat that it will be very difficult.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Before I took this course, I knew close to nothing about statistical mechanics. Now, I can write a Monte Carlo simulation. Even if I forget the details along the way, Professor Batista's notes are a great resource and have been promoted to the top shelf of my book case.
This course demonstrated how fundamental ideas in chemistry, such as chemical equilibria and ideal gas law, were derived.
I expect that it will contribute to background study of my research area.
